topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Cold open on how to ask for feedback authentically, then Lenny introduces Kim Scott’s background and what they’ll cover (practicing Radical Candor, getting feedback, people-pleasing, culture pitfalls).

topics.title: Sponsor Break: Jira Product Discovery
topics.summary: Sponsor read describing Jira Product Discovery as a prioritization and roadmapping tool to replace spreadsheets and improve cross-functional collaboration.

topics.title: Defining Radical Candor and the 2x2
topics.summary: Kim explains Radical Candor as caring personally while challenging directly, and contrasts it with obnoxious aggression, manipulative insincerity, and ruinous empathy.

topics.title: Why Radical Candor matters: Kim’s “um” story
topics.summary: Kim shares how a boss’s direct feedback about saying “um” improved her communication and career, illustrating how care + direct challenge builds trust and performance.

topics.title: Tactical guidance: HIP + CORE feedback framework
topics.summary: Kim resists scripts but offers principles: be Humble, Helpful, Immediate, In-person/synchronous, praise Public/criticize Private, avoid Personality judgments; then use CORE (Context, Observation, Result, next stEp).

topics.title: Ruinous empathy story: avoiding hard truths hurts everyone
topics.summary: Kim recounts delaying direct feedback to “Bob,” leading to prolonged poor performance, team drag, and eventual firing—showing why ruinous empathy is the most common and damaging failure mode.

topics.title: People-pleasing, bias, and giving earlier feedback
topics.summary: They discuss why candor is hard (need to be liked, likability/competence bias) and how Kim would redo the Bob situation: ask diagnostic questions, then be specific and persistent about issues to ensure the message lands.

topics.title: Career conversations as a way to show care
topics.summary: Kim and Lenny discuss anchoring feedback in an employee’s goals and having structured career conversations (past, future vision, action plan) to build trust and development momentum.

topics.title: Practicing candor in a ruinous-empathy culture
topics.summary: Kim explains the “order of operations”: start by soliciting criticism to build trust, rather than trying to force a feedback culture solely by giving more direct feedback.

topics.title: How to solicit feedback weekly and make it routine
topics.summary: Kim recommends asking direct reports weekly (and peers/boss too), using an authentic go-to question, varying prompts, and not accepting “everything’s fine” as an answer.

topics.title: Handling discomfort, defensiveness, and rewarding candor
topics.summary: Kim outlines steps after asking: embrace silence, listen to understand, ask follow-ups, and reward candor—either by fixing issues visibly or acknowledging partial agreement and circling back when you disagree.

topics.title: Sponsor Break: Jira Product Discovery (repeat)
topics.summary: Sponsor read repeats key benefits: centralized ideas, prioritization, roadmap sharing, and collaboration across stakeholders in Jira Product Discovery.
